# NSTextRange

**Class**

A class that represents a contiguous range between two locations inside document contents.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSTextRange
```

## Overview

An `NSTextRange` consists of the starting and terminating locations. There the two basic properties: [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextRange/location] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextRange/endLocation], respectively. The terminating [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextRange/location], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextRange/endLocation], is directly following the last location in the range. For example, a location contains a range if `(range.location <= location) && (location < range.endLocation)` is `true`.

## Creating a text range

- **init(location:)**: Creates a new text range at the location you specify.
- **init(location:end:)**: Creates a new text range with the starting and ending locations you specify.

## Characteristics of the text range

- **location**: The starting location of the text range.
- **endLocation**: The ending location of the text range.
- **isEmpty**: Returns whether the text range is empty.

## Comparing text ranges

- **intersection(_:)**: Returns the range, if any, where two text ranges intersect.
- **intersects(_:)**: Determines if two ranges intersect.
- **isEqual(to:)**: Compares two text ranges.
- **union(_:)**: Returns a new text range by forming the union with the text range you provide.

## Finding text within the text range

- **contains(_:)**: Determines if the text location you specify is in the current text range.
- **contains(_:)**: Determines if the text range you specify is in the current text range.

## Location and selection

- **NSTextSelection**: A class that represents a single logical selection context that corresponds to an insertion point.
- **NSTextSelectionNavigation**: An interface you use to expose methods for obtaining results from actions performed on text selections.
- **NSTextLocation**: An interface you implement that represents an abstract location inside your document’s content.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
